::: {layout-ncol=2}
Welcome to SLUBI, where our mission is to provide support and training in bioinformatics for researchers, students, and faculty at SLU.
<br><br>
As a hub for bioinformatics expertise within the university, we facilitate the application of computational methods in biological research and strieve to build a strong community of bioinformaticians within SLU.
<br><br>
Our staff is located on the 3 SLU campuses in Ultuna, Ume√• and Alnarp and available to you in [many different ways](contact.qmd).

![](images/SLUBI_logo.png){.class width=50% fig-align="center"}

:::

# Services
::: {.card}
<br>
We offer a range of bioinformatics services, including data analysis, software support, consultation, and training, tailored to meet the diverse needs of the university community.

In addition to our core services, we offer customized solutions and training courses to support researchers at every stage of their bioinformatics projects, from data acquisition to publication.

More information on our support [here](support_what.qmd).

:::

# Drop-in
:::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"}

Join our weekly digital drop-in sessions to ask questions, discuss your project, or find the best tools and analyses for your data.

Every Wednesday from 13:00 to 14:00 on Zoom. More information [here](dropin.qmd).
::::

::: {.g-col-6}


# Training
:::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"}

We offer curated [courses](courses.qmd), [seminars & workshops](workshops.qmd), and personalized training sessions to advance bioinformatics expertise at SLU.

Explore our current courses or [contact us](contact.qmd) to propose new and interesting topics.
::::

# Seminar series
::: {.card}

<center>
<br>
We are proud to present our collaborative workshop series, the Three Bees: 

![](images/3bees_fulltext_ampersand2.png){#id .class width=70%}

Statistical concepts and bioinformatics tools explained to you by experts. Informative lessons and hands-on coding exercises on a variety of topics. 

All of this and more in our collaboration with SLU's Center for Statistics.
